pages.text: $(l)(Passive-ShipDestroyed)/$$(br)Retaliation is exactly the same as the $(l:naval_warfare:abilities/active/missile)Missile/$ ability. Instead of activating it manually, it activates automatically when it's owner ship is destroyed. It will auto-target a non-damaged ship tile, and deal damage to it. Each Retaliation has one stat: Damage. It determines how much damage the fired missile will do.

$(l)Tips & Tricks:/$$(li)If you ever face a ship with this ability, note that you don't have to destroy it right away. If you know where the ship is, you may want to wait and destroy it later in the round, since its destruction will basically reveal AND damage a ship of yours. Only destroy it if you really have to, either because there aren't many ships left or because you want to disable its active ability.

$(li)Remember that passive abilities can't trigger other passive abilities. If you're lucky, one of your own ship's passive abilities may end up taking out a ship that has this passive ability, in which case this passive doesn't trigger!$(li)Just like regular Missiles, Retaliation only deals 1 damage to $(l:naval_warfare:abilities/passive/energy_shield)Energy Shields/$ regardless of its actual damage.
